Comments: Frozen, icy snowpack with a dusting of new snow.
Shears at 15cm. Snowpack moist and sticky.
Easy shear at 14cm. Snowpack quite sticky.
Yet another fine day,  calm, dry and sunny, Glencoe hills mainly clear but extensive cloud inversion to the South.
Calm clear and sunny day, blanket of  low cloud in glens mainly to the South and West. Cornice collapse NE aspect at 1000 metres.
surface layer moist @ 0 degrees, colder snow within the snowpack.
Snow pit on East facing aspect

Easy shears at 20cm.
Moderate shear at 10cm.
Pit site chosen to test fresh deposits of windslab on SE aspect.
Avalanche activity noted on NW aspect.
Field tests showed easy shears @ 29cms and 69cms.
Two avalanches noted and several sloughs mainly on SE aspects
Strong Westerly winds and frequent snow showers, very poor visibility.
Pit depth to 120cm.- well into stable refrozen layer (total snow depth - 250cm.)
Surface of snowpack beginning to become more moist in rising freezing level.  Sheltered profile site.
Graupel present in snowpack at shear levels.
Full depth pit.  Chaotic wind direction at pit site.
Poorly bonded snow pack on NE aspects above 800 m. Avalanches noted.
Many slopes wind scoured, greatest accumulations of snow in high NE-E worries. Old snow where exposed on higher slopes is firm icy and unforgiving.
Landslide noted on South side of Aonach Eagach
Deep accumulations of blown snow on N-E aspects above 800 metres elsewhere many slopes scoured.
Snow showers at first with a more persistent period of heavier snow during the afternoon. Very stormy with much wind transport of existing and new snow.
Snow pit on large patch of snow
Overnight/early Am avalanche debris noted in centre of corrie from headwall, photos on blog. Very heavy rain and mild conditions overnight. Drier at time of observations.

Location: West flank, Stob Coire nan Lochan

Comments: Difficult to find area of fresh snow above refrozen snowpack to site pit.
profile site in same area as previous day near the summit of Meall a Bhuiridh
Moderately bonded surface crust has formed.
A typical wind speed and direction at pit site.
Pit site in sheltered area with non-representative wind speed and direction.
Light general cover of recent snow but no significant accumulations noted. Old snow very firm.
Mild and wet overnight, drier and a bit cooler today. Snowpack reduced greatly, most significant deposits remaining in sheltered locations such as gullies and high Northerly and Easterly corries.
Wind direction highly variable within corrie but generally Easterly. New snow persistent through the day.
Windward slopes exposed to SW gales have thin snow cover but icy at higher altitudes, some deep drifting into sheltered lee areas.
Heavy snow showers in the afternoon
Pit site on old snow patch.
Light new snow cover above 800 metres.
Snow pit dug on a snow patch due to lack of snow cover.
Snow pit dug on snow patch at Corrie lip.
